title: Dev2Prod - Task plan business rules of an offering bundle are skipped during import
content:
During a Dev2Prod import, the task plan business rules of an offering bundle are skipped, and a warning that resembles the following is displayed:

Cause 1

During import, the Package Manager doesn't convert an offering ID (such as [Id='12263']) in a business rule to a unique ID in the target tenant, so it can't find the offering in the target tenant. 

In this example, the offering bundle defines user option mappings (Bundled offerings > Set user option mappings); tasks are created in the Task plan tab. Each task contains a business rule that references the ID of the corresponding bundled offering. The following is an example:

Description: ${entity.RequestsOffering.OfferingBundlesToOfferings[Id='12263'].Description}

Although the package manager creates the task plan for the target tenant, the tasks can't be associated with an offering with a unique ID for the target tenant. 

Solution 1

Manually set the user option mappings of the offering bundle in the target tenant. 

Cause 2

During import, the Package Manager doesn't convert an offering ID in a business rule to a unique ID in the target tenant when multiple offering IDs have the same display label.
In this example, the offering's Task Plan business rule "Create a new record" defines Offering mapping for the new Record (Request); however, the target tenant already has multiple offerings with the same Display Label.
While the package manager generates the task plan for the target tenant according to this business rule, the tasks cannot be linked to an offering with a unique ID for the target tenant.

Solution  2

You can do any of the following to resolve the issue:

  • Make sure offerings have distinct display labels.
  • Once the import is successfully finished (with a warning), manually update the business rules referring to the Offering.
